oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1941-08-23 - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 2 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from August 23, 1941. Featuring Louie Buck (announcer), George D. Hay (host), and performers Roy Acuff, Mac McGar and his Tennessee Mountaineers, Pap & Odie (likely Lonnie Wilson and Curly Rhodes respectively), and Bill Monroe (mentioned but not present on this part). Held at War Memorial Auditorium, Nashville, TN.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Mac McGar; Tennessee Mountaineers; Pap & Odie; Roy Acuff
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: George D. Hay introduces Mac McGar and his Tennessee Mountaineers -- Wake Up Susan (Mac McGar and his Tennessee Mountaineers) -- Louie Buck talks -- George D. Hay introduces Pap & Odie -- Froggie Went A-Courtin' (Pap & Odie) -- George D. Hay talks -- Froggie Went A-Courtin' (reprise) (Pap & Odie) -- Prince Albert commercial (Louie Buck, George D. Hay, Roy Acuff) -- George D. Hay introduces Roy Acuff -- The Precious Jewel (Roy Acuff) -- George D. Hay talks -- The Precious Jewel (reprise) (Roy Acuff) -- George D. Hay introduces Mac McGar and his Tennessee Mountaineers -- Buffalo Gal (Mac McGar and his Tennessee Mountaineers) -- Prince Albert commercial (Louie Buck, George D. Hay, Roy Acuff) -- George D. Hay introduces Roy Acuff -- Ida Red (Roy Acuff) -- Closing statement (George D. Hay) -- Closing statement (Louie Buck)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Buck, Louis, 1910-1971; Hay, George D.
